00019 
00020 template<typename eT>
00021 inline
00022 basic_mat<eT>::~basic_mat()
00023   {
00024   arma_extra_debug_sigprint_this(this);
00025   
00026   if(n_elem > sizeof(mem_local)/sizeof(eT) )
00027     {
00028     delete [] mem;
00029     }
00030     
00031   if(arma_config::debug == true)
00032     {
00033     access::rw(mem) = 0;  // try to expose buggy code that still accesses a deleted 'mat'
00034     }
00035   
00036   isnt_supported_elem_type<eT>::check();
00037   }
00038

00047   //, mem(0)
00048   , mem(mem)
00049   {
00050   arma_extra_debug_sigprint_this(this);
00051   }

00054 //! construct the matrix to have user specified dimensions

00059   , n_cols(0)
00060   , n_elem(0)
00061   //, mem(0)

00065   
00066   init(in_n_rows, in_n_cols);
00067   }

00071 //! change the matrix to have user specified dimensions (data is not preserved)
00072 template<typename eT>
00073 inline
00074 void
00075 basic_mat<eT>::set_size(const u32 in_n_rows, const u32 in_n_cols)
00076   {
00077   arma_extra_debug_sigprint(arma_boost::format("in_n_rows = %d, in_n_cols = %d") % in_n_rows % in_n_cols);
00078   
00079   init(in_n_rows,in_n_cols);
00080   }

00082 
00083 //! internal matrix construction; if the requested size is small enough, memory from the stack is used. otherwise memory is allocated via 'new'
00084 template<typename eT>
00085 inline
00086 void
00087 basic_mat<eT>::init(const u32 in_n_rows, const u32 in_n_cols)
00088   {
00089   arma_extra_debug_sigprint( arma_boost::format("in_n_rows = %d, in_n_cols = %d") % in_n_rows % in_n_cols );
00090   
00091   
00092   const u32 new_n_elem = in_n_rows * in_n_cols;
00093 
00094   if(n_elem == new_n_elem)
00095     {
00096     access::rw(n_rows) = in_n_rows;
00097     access::rw(n_cols) = in_n_cols;
00098     }
00099   else
00100     {
00101     
00102     if(n_elem > sizeof(mem_local)/sizeof(eT) )
00103       {
00104       delete [] mem;
00105       }
00106     
00107     if(new_n_elem <= sizeof(mem_local)/sizeof(eT) )
00108       {
00109       access::rw(mem) = mem_local;
00110       }
00111     else
00112       {
00113       access::rw(mem) = new(std::nothrow) eT[new_n_elem];
00114       arma_check( (mem == 0), "basic_mat::init(): out of memory" );
00115       }
00116     
00117     access::rw(n_elem) = new_n_elem;
00118 
00119     if(new_n_elem == 0)
00120       {
00121       access::rw(n_rows) = 0;
00122       access::rw(n_cols) = 0;
00123       }
00124     else
00125       {
00126       access::rw(n_rows) = in_n_rows;
00127       access::rw(n_cols) = in_n_cols;
00128       }
00129     
00130     }
00131   
00132   }
00133

00197 //! internal function to create the matrix from a textual description
00198 template<typename eT>
00199 inline 
00200 void
00201 basic_mat<eT>::init(const std::string& text)
00202   {
00203   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00204   
00205   //
00206   // work out the size
00207   
00208   u32 t_n_rows = 0;
00209   u32 t_n_cols = 0;
00210   
00211   bool t_n_cols_found = false;
00212   
00213   std::string token;
00214   
00215   std::string::size_type line_start = 0;
00216   std::string::size_type   line_end = 0;
00217   
00218   while( line_start < text.length() )
00219     {
00220     
00221     line_end = text.find(';', line_start);
00222     
00223     if(line_end == std::string::npos)
00224       line_end = text.length()-1;
00225     
00226     std::string::size_type line_len = line_end - line_start + 1;
00227     std::stringstream line_stream( text.substr(line_start,line_len) );
00228     
00229     
00230     u32 line_n_cols = 0;
00231     while(line_stream >> token)
00232       {
00233       ++line_n_cols;
00234       }
00235     
00236     
00237     if(line_n_cols > 0)
00238       {
00239       if(t_n_cols_found == false)
00240         {
00241         t_n_cols = line_n_cols;
00242         t_n_cols_found = true;
00243         }
00244       else
00245         arma_check( (line_n_cols != t_n_cols), "basic_mat::init(): inconsistent number of columns in given string");
00246       
00247       ++t_n_rows;
00248       }
00249     line_start = line_end+1;
00250     
00251     }
00252     
00253   basic_mat<eT> &x = *this;
00254   x.set_size(t_n_rows, t_n_cols);
00255   
00256   line_start = 0;
00257   line_end = 0;
00258   
00259   u32 row = 0;
00260   
00261   while( line_start < text.length() )
00262     {
00263     
00264     line_end = text.find(';', line_start);
00265     
00266     if(line_end == std::string::npos)
00267       line_end = text.length()-1;
00268     
00269     std::string::size_type line_len = line_end - line_start + 1;
00270     std::stringstream line_stream( text.substr(line_start,line_len) );
00271     
00272 //     u32 col = 0;
00273 //     while(line_stream >> token)
00274 //       {
00275 //       x.at(row,col) = strtod(token.c_str(), 0);
00276 //       ++col;
00277 //       }
00278     
00279     u32 col = 0;
00280     eT val;
00281     while(line_stream >> val)
00282       {
00283       x.at(row,col) = val;
00284       ++col;
00285       }
00286     
00287     ++row;
00288     line_start = line_end+1;
00289     }
00290   
00291   }

00295 //! Set the matrix to be equal to the specified scalar. NOTE: the size of the matrix will be 1x1, as a scalar is a 1x1 matrix.
00296 template<typename eT>
00297 inline
00298 const basic_mat<eT>&
00299 basic_mat<eT>::operator=(const eT val)
00300   {
00301   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00302   
00303   init(1,1);
00304   access::rw(mem[0]) = val;
00305   return *this;
00306   }

00310 //! In-place addition of a scalar to all elements of the matrix
00311 template<typename eT>
00312 inline
00313 const basic_mat<eT>&
00314 basic_mat<eT>::operator+=(const eT val)
00315   {
00316   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00317   
00318   for(u32 i=0; i<n_elem; ++i)
00319     {
00320     access::rw(mem[i]) += val;
00321     }
00322   
00323   return *this;
00324   }
00325 
00326 
00327 
00328 //! In-place subtraction of a scalar from all elements of the matrix
00329 template<typename eT>
00330 inline
00331 const basic_mat<eT>&
00332 basic_mat<eT>::operator-=(const eT val)
00333   {
00334   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00335   
00336   for(u32 i=0; i<n_elem; ++i)
00337     {
00338     access::rw(mem[i]) -= val;
00339     }
00340       
00341   return *this;
00342   }

00413 //! construct a matrix from a given matrix
00414 template<typename eT>
00415 inline
00416 void
00417 basic_mat<eT>::init(const basic_mat<eT> &x)
00418   {
00419   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00420   
00421   if(this != &x)
00422     {
00423     init(x.n_rows, x.n_cols);
00424     syslib::copy_elem( memptr(), x.mem, n_elem );
00425     }
00426   }

00443   syslib::copy_elem( memptr(), aux_mem, n_elem );

00517 
00518 //! for constructing a complex matrix out of two non-complex matrices
00519 template<typename eT>
00520 template<typename T1, typename T2>
00521 inline
00522 basic_mat<eT>::basic_mat
00523   (
00524   const arma_base<typename basic_mat<eT>::pod_type,T1>& A,
00525   const arma_base<typename basic_mat<eT>::pod_type,T2>& B
00526   )
00527   : n_rows(0)
00528   , n_cols(0)
00529   , n_elem(0)
00530   //, mem(0)
00531   , mem(mem)
00532   {
00533   arma_extra_debug_sigprint_this(this);
00534   
00535   arma_type_check< is_complex<eT>::value == false >::apply();   //!< compile-time abort if eT isn't std::complex
00536   
00537   typedef typename T1::elem_type T;
00538   arma_type_check< is_complex<T>::value == true >::apply();   //!< compile-time abort if T is std::complex
00539   
00540   isnt_same_type<std::complex<T>, eT>::check();   //!< compile-time abort if types are not compatible
00541   
00542   const unwrap<T1> tmp_A(A.get_ref());
00543   const unwrap<T2> tmp_B(B.get_ref());
00544   
00545   const basic_mat<T>& X = tmp_A.M;
00546   const basic_mat<T>& Y = tmp_B.M;
00547   
00548   arma_assert_same_size(X, Y, "basic_mat()");
00549   
00550   init(X.n_rows, Y.n_cols);
00551   
00552   const T* X_mem = X.mem;
00553   const T* Y_mem = Y.mem;
00554   
00555   for(u32 i=0; i<n_elem; ++i)
00556     {
00557     access::rw(mem[i]) = std::complex<T>(X_mem[i], Y_mem[i]);
00558     }
00559   }

00565 inline
00566 basic_mat<eT>::basic_mat(const subview<eT>& X)
00567   : n_rows(0)
00568   , n_cols(0)
00569   , n_elem(0)
00570   //, mem(0)
00571   , mem(mem)
00572   {
00573   arma_extra_debug_sigprint_this(this);
00574   
00575   this->operator=(X);
00576   }

00580 //! construct a matrix from subview (e.g. construct a matrix from a delayed submatrix operation)
00581 template<typename eT>

00584 basic_mat<eT>::operator=(const subview<eT>& X)
00585   {

00693 //! creation of subview (row vector)
00694 template<typename eT>
00695 inline
00696 subview_row<eT>
00697 basic_mat<eT>::row(const u32 row_num)
00698   {
00699   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00700   
00701   arma_debug_check( row_num >= n_rows, "basic_mat::row(): row out of bounds" );
00702   
00703   return subview_row<eT>(*this, row_num);
00704   }

00751 
00752 
00753 //! creation of subview (submatrix comprised of specified row vectors)
00754 template<typename eT>
00755 inline
00756 subview<eT>
00757 basic_mat<eT>::rows(const u32 in_row1, const u32 in_row2)
00758   {
00759   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00760   
00761   arma_debug_check
00762     (
00763     (in_row1 > in_row2) || (in_row2 >= n_rows),
00764     "basic_mat::rows(): indices out of bounds or incorrectly used"
00765     );
00766   
00767   return subview<eT>(*this, in_row1, 0, in_row2, n_cols-1);
00768   }
00769 
00770 
00771 
00772 //! creation of subview (submatrix comprised of specified row vectors)
00773 template<typename eT>
00774 inline
00775 const subview<eT>
00776 basic_mat<eT>::rows(const u32 in_row1, const u32 in_row2) const
00777   {
00778   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00779   
00780   arma_debug_check
00781     (
00782     (in_row1 > in_row2) || (in_row2 >= n_rows),
00783     "basic_mat::rows(): indices out of bounds or incorrectly used"
00784     );
00785   
00786   return subview<eT>(*this, in_row1, 0, in_row2, n_cols-1);
00787   }
00788 
00789 
00790 
00791 //! creation of subview (submatrix comprised of specified column vectors)
00792 template<typename eT>
00793 inline
00794 subview<eT>
00795 basic_mat<eT>::cols(const u32 in_col1, const u32 in_col2)
00796   {
00797   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00798   
00799   arma_debug_check
00800     (
00801     (in_col1 > in_col2) || (in_col2 >= n_cols),
00802     "basic_mat::cols(): indices out of bounds or incorrectly used"
00803     );
00804   
00805   return subview<eT>(*this, 0, in_col1, n_rows-1, in_col2);
00806   }
00807 
00808 
00809 
00810 //! creation of subview (submatrix comprised of specified column vectors)
00811 template<typename eT>
00812 inline
00813 const subview<eT>
00814 basic_mat<eT>::cols(const u32 in_col1, const u32 in_col2) const
00815   {
00816   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00817   
00818   arma_debug_check
00819     (
00820     (in_col1 > in_col2) || (in_col2 >= n_cols),
00821     "basic_mat::cols(): indices out of bounds or incorrectly used"
00822     );
00823   
00824   return subview<eT>(*this, 0, in_col1, n_rows-1, in_col2);
00825   }
00826 
00827 
00828 
00829 //! creation of subview (submatrix)
00830 template<typename eT>
00831 inline
00832 subview<eT>
00833 basic_mat<eT>::submat(const u32 in_row1, const u32 in_col1, const u32 in_row2, const u32 in_col2)
00834   {
00835   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00836   
00837   arma_debug_check
00838     (
00839     (in_row1 > in_row2) || (in_col1 >  in_col2) || (in_row2 >= n_rows) || (in_col2 >= n_cols),
00840     "basic_mat::submat(): indices out of bounds or incorrectly used"
00841     );
00842   
00843   return subview<eT>(*this, in_row1, in_col1, in_row2, in_col2);
00844   }
00845 
00846 
00847 
00848 //! creation of subview (generic submatrix)
00849 template<typename eT>
00850 inline
00851 const subview<eT>
00852 basic_mat<eT>::submat(const u32 in_row1, const u32 in_col1, const u32 in_row2, const u32 in_col2) const
00853   {
00854   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00855   
00856   arma_debug_check
00857     (
00858     (in_row1 > in_row2) || (in_col1 >  in_col2) || (in_row2 >= n_rows) || (in_col2 >= n_cols),
00859     "basic_mat::submat(): indices out of bounds or incorrectly used"
00860     );
00861     
00862   return subview<eT>(*this, in_row1, in_col1, in_row2, in_col2);
00863   }
00864 
00865 
00866 
00867 //! creation of diagview (diagonal)
00868 template<typename eT>
00869 inline
00870 diagview<eT>
00871 basic_mat<eT>::diag(const s32 in_id)
00872   {
00873   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00874   
00875   const u32 row_offset = (in_id < 0) ? -in_id : 0;
00876   const u32 col_offset = (in_id > 0) ?  in_id : 0;
00877   
00878   arma_debug_check
00879     (
00880     (row_offset >= n_rows) || (col_offset >= n_cols),
00881     "basic_mat::diag(): out of bounds"
00882     );
00883   
00884   const u32 len = (std::min)(n_rows - row_offset, n_cols - col_offset);
00885   
00886   return diagview<eT>(*this, row_offset, col_offset, len);
00887   }
00888 
00889 
00890 
00891 //! creation of diagview (diagonal)
00892 template<typename eT>
00893 inline
00894 const diagview<eT>
00895 basic_mat<eT>::diag(const s32 in_id) const
00896   {
00897   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00898   
00899   const u32 row_offset = (in_id < 0) ? -in_id : 0;
00900   const u32 col_offset = (in_id > 0) ?  in_id : 0;
00901   
00902   arma_debug_check
00903     (
00904     (row_offset >= n_rows) || (col_offset >= n_cols),
00905     "basic_mat::diag(): out of bounds"
00906     );
00907   
00908   
00909   const u32 len = (std::min)(n_rows - row_offset, n_cols - col_offset);
00910   
00911   return diagview<eT>(*this, row_offset, col_offset, len);
00912   }
00913 
00914 
00915 
00916 template<typename eT>
00917 inline
00918 void
00919 basic_mat<eT>::swap_rows(const u32 in_row1, const u32 in_row2)
00920   {
00921   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00922   
00923   arma_debug_check
00924     (
00925     (in_row1 >= n_rows) || (in_row2 >= n_rows),
00926     "basic_mat::swap_rows(): out of bounds"
00927     );
00928   
00929   for(u32 col=0; col<n_cols; ++col)
00930     {
00931     const u32 offset = col*n_rows;
00932     const u32 pos1   = in_row1 + offset;
00933     const u32 pos2   = in_row2 + offset;
00934     
00935     const eT tmp          = mem[pos1];
00936     access::rw(mem[pos1]) = mem[pos2];
00937     access::rw(mem[pos2]) = tmp;
00938     }
00939   
00940   }
00941 
00942 
00943 
00944 template<typename eT>
00945 inline
00946 void
00947 basic_mat<eT>::swap_cols(const u32 in_col1, const u32 in_col2)
00948   {
00949   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00950   
00951   arma_debug_check
00952     (
00953     (in_col1 >= n_cols) || (in_col2 >= n_cols),
00954     "basic_mat::swap_cols(): out of bounds"
00955     );
00956   
00957   eT* ptr1 = colptr(in_col1);
00958   eT* ptr2 = colptr(in_col2);
00959   
00960   for(u32 row=0; row<n_rows; ++row)
00961     {
00962     const eT tmp = ptr1[row];
00963     ptr1[row]    = ptr2[row];
00964     ptr2[row]    = tmp;
00965     }
00966   
00967   }
00968 
00969 
00970 
00971 //! create a matrix from op_data, i.e. run the previously delayed unary operations
00972 template<typename eT>
00973 template<typename T1, typename op_type>
00974 inline
00975 basic_mat<eT>::basic_mat(const op_data<T1, op_type>& X)
00976   : n_rows(0)
00977   , n_cols(0)
00978   , n_elem(0)
00979   //, mem(0)
00980   , mem(mem)
00981   {
00982   arma_extra_debug_sigprint_this(this);
00983 
00984   isnt_same_type<eT, typename T1::elem_type>::check();
00985   
00986   op_type::apply(*this, X);
00987   }
00988 
00989 
00990 
00991 //! create a matrix from op_data, i.e. run the previously delayed unary operations
00992 template<typename eT>
00993 template<typename T1, typename op_type>
00994 inline
00995 const basic_mat<eT>&
00996 basic_mat<eT>::operator=(const op_data<T1, op_type>& X)
00997   {
00998   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
00999 
01000   isnt_same_type<eT, typename T1::elem_type>::check();
01001   
01002   op_type::apply(*this, X);
01003   
01004   return *this;
01005   }
01006 
01007 
01008 
01009 //! in-place matrix addition, with the right-hand-side operand having delayed operations
01010 template<typename eT>
01011 template<typename T1, typename op_type>
01012 inline
01013 const basic_mat<eT>&
01014 basic_mat<eT>::operator+=(const op_data<T1, op_type>& X)
01015   {
01016   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
01017   
01018   isnt_same_type<eT, typename T1::elem_type>::check();
01019   
01020   glue_plus::apply_inplace(*this, X);
01021   
01022   return *this;
01023   }
01024

01028 template<typename eT>
01029 template<typename T1, typename op_type>
01030 inline
01031 const basic_mat<eT>&
01032 basic_mat<eT>::operator-=(const op_data<T1, op_type>& X)
01033   {
01034   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
01035   
01036   isnt_same_type<eT, typename T1::elem_type>::check();
01037   
01038   glue_minus::apply_inplace(*this, X);
01039   
01040   return *this;
01041   }

01049 const basic_mat<eT>&
01050 basic_mat<eT>::operator*=(const op_data<T1, op_type>& X)
01051   {
01052   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
01053   
01054   isnt_same_type<eT, typename T1::elem_type>::check();
01055

01057   
01058   return *this;

01095 
01096 
01097 //! create a matrix from glue_data, i.e. run the previously delayed binary operations
01098 template<typename eT>
01099 template<typename T1, typename T2, typename glue_type>
01100 inline
01101 basic_mat<eT>::basic_mat(const glue_data<T1, T2, glue_type>& X)
01102   : n_rows(0)
01103   , n_cols(0)
01104   , n_elem(0)
01105   //, mem(0)
01106   , mem(mem)
01107   {
01108   arma_extra_debug_sigprint_this(this);
01109   this->operator=(X);
01110   }
01111 
01112 
01113 
01114 //! create a matrix from glue_data, i.e. run the previously delayed binary operations
01115 template<typename eT>
01116 template<typename T1, typename T2, typename glue_type>
01117 inline
01118 const basic_mat<eT>&
01119 basic_mat<eT>::operator=(const glue_data<T1, T2, glue_type>& X)
01120   {
01121   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
01122   
01123   // TODO:
01124   // it may be simpler to pass the two objects (currently wrapped in X)
01125   // directly to the apply function.
01126   // (many adjustments throughout the source code will be required)
01127   
01128   isnt_same_type<eT, typename T1::elem_type>::check();
01129   isnt_same_type<eT, typename T2::elem_type>::check();
01130   
01131   glue_type::apply(*this, X);
01132   
01133   return *this;
01134   }
01135 
01136 
01137 //! in-place matrix addition, with the right-hand-side operands having delayed operations
01138 template<typename eT>
01139 template<typename T1, typename T2, typename glue_type>
01140 inline
01141 const basic_mat<eT>&
01142 basic_mat<eT>::operator+=(const glue_data<T1, T2, glue_type>& X)
01143   {
01144   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
01145   
01146   isnt_same_type<eT, typename T1::elem_type>::check();
01147   isnt_same_type<eT, typename T2::elem_type>::check();
01148   
01149   glue_plus::apply_inplace(*this, X);
01150   
01151   return *this;
01152   }
01153

01161 basic_mat<eT>::operator-=(const glue_data<T1, T2, glue_type>& X)

01165   isnt_same_type<eT, typename T1::elem_type>::check();

01229 //! linear element accessor (treats the matrix as a vector); bounds checking not done when ARMA_NO_DEBUG is defined
01230 template<typename eT>
01231 inline
01232 eT&
01233 basic_mat<eT>::operator() (const u32 i)
01234   {
01235   arma_debug_check( (i >= n_elem), "basic_mat::operator(): index out of bounds");
01236   return access::rw(mem[i]);
01237   }

01273 
01274 //! element accessor; bounds checking not done when ARMA_NO_DEBUG is defined
01275 template<typename eT>
01276 inline
01277 eT&
01278 basic_mat<eT>::operator() (const u32 in_row, const u32 in_col)
01279   {
01280   arma_debug_check( ((in_row >= n_rows) || (in_col >= n_cols)), "basic_mat::operator(): index out of bounds");
01281   return access::rw(mem[in_row + in_col*n_rows]);
01282   }

01290 basic_mat<eT>::operator() (const u32 in_row, const u32 in_col) const
01291   {
01292   arma_debug_check( ((in_row >= n_rows) || (in_col >= n_cols)), "basic_mat::operator(): index out of bounds");
01293   return mem[in_row + in_col*n_rows];
01294   }

01319 
01320 //! returns true if the object can be interpreted as a column or row vector
01321 template<typename eT>
01322 inline
01323 bool
01324 basic_mat<eT>::is_vec() const
01325   {
01326   return ( (n_rows == 1) || (n_cols == 1) );
01327   }
01328 
01329 
01330 
01331 //! returns true if the object has the same number of non-zero rows and columnns
01332 template<typename eT>
01333 inline
01334 bool
01335 basic_mat<eT>::is_square() const
01336   {
01337   return ( (n_rows == n_cols) && (n_elem > 0) );
01338   }

01343 template<typename eT>
01344 inline
01345 eT*
01346 basic_mat<eT>::colptr(const u32 in_col)
01347   {
01348   return & access::rw(mem[in_col*n_rows]);
01349   }

01354 template<typename eT>

01357 basic_mat<eT>::colptr(const u32 in_col) const
01358   {

01360   }

01385 
01386 //! print contents of the matrix, optionally preceding with a user specified line of text
01387 template<typename eT>
01388 inline
01389 void
01390 basic_mat<eT>::print(const std::string extra_text) const
01391   {
01392   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
01393   
01394   if(extra_text.length() != 0)
01395     {
01396     cout << extra_text << '\n';
01397     }
01398   
01399   cout << *this << '\n';
01400   }
01401 
01402 
01403 
01404 //! fill the matrix with the specified value
01405 template<typename eT>
01406 inline
01407 void
01408 basic_mat<eT>::fill(const eT val)
01409   {
01410   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
01411   
01412   for(u32 i=0; i<n_elem; ++i)
01413     {
01414     access::rw(mem[i]) = val;
01415     }
01416   }
01417 
01418 
01419 
01420 template<typename eT>
01421 inline
01422 void
01423 basic_mat<eT>::zeros()
01424   {
01425   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
01426   
01427   fill(eT(0));
01428   }
01429 
01430 
01431 
01432 template<typename eT>
01433 inline
01434 void
01435 basic_mat<eT>::zeros(const u32 in_rows, const u32 in_cols)
01436   {
01437   arma_extra_debug_sigprint( arma_boost::format("in_rows = %d, in_cols = %d") % in_rows % in_cols );
01438 
01439   set_size(in_rows, in_cols);
01440   fill(eT(0));
01441   }
01442 
01443 
01444 
01445 template<typename eT>
01446 inline
01447 void
01448 basic_mat<eT>::reset()
01449   {
01450   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
01451   
01452   init(0,0);
01453   }
01454 
01455 
01456 
01457 //! save the matrix to a file
01458 template<typename eT>
01459 inline
01460 void
01461 basic_mat<eT>::save(const std::string name, const file_type type) const
01462   {
01463   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
01464   
01465   switch(type)
01466     {
01467     case raw_ascii:
01468       diskio::save_raw_ascii(*this, name);
01469       break;
01470     
01471     case arma_ascii:
01472       diskio::save_arma_ascii(*this, name);
01473       break;
01474     
01475     case arma_binary:
01476       diskio::save_arma_binary(*this, name);
01477       break;
01478       
01479     case pgm_binary:
01480       diskio::save_pgm_binary(*this, name);
01481       break;
01482     
01483     default:
01484       arma_stop("basic_mat::save(): unknown type");
01485     }
01486   
01487   }
01488 
01489 
01490 
01491 //! load a matrix from a file
01492 template<typename eT>
01493 inline
01494 void
01495 basic_mat<eT>::load(const std::string name, const file_type type)
01496   {
01497   arma_extra_debug_sigprint();
01498   
01499   switch(type)
01500     {
01501     case auto_detect:
01502       diskio::load_auto_detect(*this, name);
01503       break;
01504     
01505     case raw_ascii:
01506       diskio::load_raw_ascii(*this, name);
01507       break;
01508     
01509     case arma_ascii:
01510       diskio::load_arma_ascii(*this, name);
01511       break;
01512     
01513     case arma_binary:
01514       diskio::load_arma_binary(*this, name);
01515       break;
01516       
01517     case pgm_binary:
01518       diskio::load_pgm_binary(*this, name);
01519       break;
01520     
01521     default:
01522       arma_stop("basic_mat:load(): unknown type");
01523     }
01524   
01525   }
01526 
01527 
01528 //! @}
